byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Uruguay gives German freighter Tacoma 24 hrs to leave or be interned because of assistance to battleship Adm Graf Spee; Brit cruiser Achilles and 2 destroyers await leaving; believed ship will be scuttled; German residents bitter about Uruguay decision; protest is forecast if Allies sink ship in safety zone; no comment from Germany; illus of Tacoma
snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 31--The Uruguayan Government this morning gave the German cargo steamer Tacoma twenty-four hours to leave the port or be interned with her crew for the duration of the war on the ground that her assistance to the Admiral ...

headline.main: URUGUAY FORCES NAZI SHIP TO LEAVE; British Lie in Wait as Tacoma Drops Anchor in the Outer Harbor at Montevideo

lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 31--The Uruguayan Government this morning gave the German cargo steamer Tacoma twenty-four hours to leave the port or be interned with her crew for the duration of the war on the ground that her assistance to the Admiral Graf Spee made her an auxiliary vessel of the German Navy.
